result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy S Pennoyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.

AS OF 4/17/2015: Credit was granted of 5 days.

superMiscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED TO RESTITUTION. PAID IN FULL. To be paid to David T.

BAIL APPLIED. COURT COSTS PAID.
DNA SURCHARGE DOES NOT APPLY.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Provide DNA sample,  if not yet provided immediately if in custody otherwise within 3 business days at the Waukesha Co. Sheriff's Dept.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 4/13/15 sentencing.
Dated 4/17/15 filed by Attorney Penegor requesting the Defendant be granted 5 days jail credit with attached fax from the jail.

Defendant Troy S Pennoyer in court with attorney Robert J. Penegor.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1. Atty. Penegor to submit any credit in writing. 


Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 7 1/2 years (Initial Confinement: 30 months, Extended Supervision: 5 years) 
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs totaling $268.00- apply bail 
- Restitution totaling $6331.00 to be paid to David T. - apply bail.
- DNA Surcharge does not apply.
- Conditions of Extended Supervision: Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
- Defendant remanded to the custody of the Sheriff forthwith.
Employment letter filed.

Defendant Troy S Pennoyer in court with attorney Robert J. Penegor.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for continued motion to suppress. Audio tape addressed. Detective Dronek sworn & testified. State rests. Troy Pennoyer sworn & testified. Defense rests. Court declares the record closed. The issues are the search of the phone, search of Mr. Pennoyer's person and search of the vehicle. Court will quash the search of the vehicle.  All other information of the phone and person were done with the consent and court will not quash this information.  Case continued as set.

Defendant Troy S Pennoyer in court with attorney Katie B Bricco.  Susan L Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Detective Ryan D. from the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. Assoc. Medicial Examiner Zelda Okia was sworn and testified on the behalf of the State. State provides exhits 1 and 2 marked and received. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects and presents closing arguments.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
